title: conda install torch?
body_html:
Hi, I'm new to torch / pytorch, so apologies for the basic question!

I see at http://pytorch.org/ that conda install pytorch is supported and it works for me. But as far as I can see, I still need to install torch separately, it's not installed as a dependency? And from what I gather at http://torch.ch/docs/getting-started.html torch itself doesn't have a conda package at all?

If this is the case, maybe it would be worth mentioning something about installing torch in the pytorch install docs or about conda in the torch docs?

PS: my motivation to install torch / pytorch is to get https://github.com/jcjohnson/neural-style to run and see if it works on my images, but following their install instructions executes a bash script which tries to install brew on my Mac, which is not what I want.

body:
Hi, I'm new to torch / pytorch, so apologies for the basic question!

I see at http://pytorch.org/ that `conda install pytorch` is supported and it works for me. But as far as I can see, I still need to install torch separately, it's not installed as a dependency? And from what I gather at http://torch.ch/docs/getting-started.html torch itself doesn't have a conda package at all?

If this is the case, maybe it would be worth mentioning something about installing `torch` in the `pytorch` install docs or about conda in the `torch` docs?

PS: my motivation to install torch / pytorch is to get https://github.com/jcjohnson/neural-style to run and see if it works on my images, but following their install instructions executes a bash script which tries to install brew on my Mac, which is not what I want.
